title: Commercial Field
text:
Commercial Field is an athletic field located in the Wingate neighborhood of <a href="Brooklyn%2C%20New%20York">Brooklyn</a>. It was home to the Commercial High School <a href="soccer">soccer</a>, <a href="American%20football">football</a>, and <a href="baseball">baseball</a> teams from around 1906. Other schools, such as Boys High, also called Commercial Field their home from time to time, as did local teams in the <a href="American%20Soccer%20League%20%281933-1983%29">American Soccer League</a> in the 1930s. The field was also the home field of the short-lived <a href="New%20York%20Brickley%20Giants">New York Brickley Giants</a>, of the early <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a>, who played two games there <a href="1921%20New%20York%20Brickley%20Giants%20season">during their 1921 season</a>. In 1926, the <a href="Brooklyn%20Horsemen">Brooklyn Horsemen</a> of the <a href="American%20Football%20League%20%281926%29">first American Football League</a> used the stadium as their home field.
The lot was acquired by the New York Parks Department in 1940, and the field survives today as a multi-sport facility called Hamilton-Metz Field named after <a href="US%20House%20of%20Representatives">US Representative</a> and <a href="New%20York%20City%20Comptroller">New York City Comptroller</a> <a href="Herman%20A.%20Metz">Herman A. Metz</a> and US Founding Father <a href="Alexander%20Hamilton">Alexander Hamilton</a>.
In 1929, a visiting <a href="Bermuda">Bermuda</a>n <a href="cricket">cricket</a> team played several matches at Commercial Field, defeating the All-New York and All-Brooklyn teams. The Bermudans returned for more tours during the 1930s. In 2006, a $1.57 million restoration was completed, with the field relaid in <a href="artificial%20turf">artificial turf</a>. Neighborhood residents often refer to the field by yet another name, Lefferts Park.
